channel.title: 8-tesla-22 (MISL JIRA)
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [TESLA22-3531] The actual spanning tree cost of port-channel is different with running-config
item.description:
Problem Description:
1.Configure spanning-tree cost of po1 to 1
2.Write running-config as startup-config
3.Reload DUT
4."Show spanning-tree active" indicates the cost of po1 is 100000. But "show running-config interface po1" indicates the value is 1.
Only happens on port-channel.
See more in attachment
Expected Results:
same with configuration
Observed Results:

Reconstruct Frequency:
100%
Workaround:

Reconstruct in old releases Yes/No version number:

Steps to Reconstruct:

Browser Type & Version:

PC Operating System:

Testing Tools:

Port Used: Fast/Giga/X-gig/NR

Attachments: Movie/Screen capture/configuration/Set-Up Drawing/Sniffer

Fatal Error Message:
item.summary: The actual spanning tree cost of port-channel is different with running-config

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: RN - need discuss with rest of cisco bug scrub team

item.title: [TESLA22-3514] STP Root port is selected mistakenly
item.description:
Problem Description:
Refer to topology in attachment, switch152 is root bridge, port-channel 1 and gi1/0/10 on switch155 have same path cost(100000) to root bridge. According to protocol standard, the port which receives lowest Port ID(port pri+port number) is selected as root port. In this scenario, gi1/0/10 receives BPDU whose Port ID is 128.10, po1 receives BPDU whose Port ID is 240.1000. In theory, the port gi1/0/10 should be selected as root port, but in effect, the po1 is selected.
Have verified same scenario on Catalyst switch, its behavior is normal.
See more in attachment
Expected Results:

Observed Results:

Reconstruct Frequency:
100%
Workaround:

Reconstruct in old releases Yes/No version number:

Steps to Reconstruct:

Browser Type & Version:

PC Operating System:

Testing Tools:

Port Used: Fast/Giga/X-gig/NR

Attachments: Movie/Screen capture/configuration/Set-Up Drawing/Sniffer

Fatal Error Message:
item.summary: STP Root port is selected mistakenly

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
does this issue happens only on Lag port?
can this issue be reproduced in nikola?

Yes, only happens on Lag port.
Could not reproduce in nikola v1.4.2.4
RN- Need discuss with bug scrub team

root port election failure when comparing LAG port priority and standalone port priority.

will test tesla 2.0.0.73 also.

item.title: [TESLA22-3457] The error rx port on Dashboard(Traffic Errors) still shows red color although interface counter and rmon statistics of proper ports are cleared.
item.description:
Problem Description:
1.TC sends Bad CRC packets, DUT detects error and marks red color for error rx port on dashboard, also there are CRC&Align Errors alarm in Table View.
2.TC stops sending traffic
3.Clear interface counter and rmon statistics. Verify all error record is 0 on DUT.
4.Waiting for refresh time or refresh now, notice that the port on Dashboard(Traffic Errors) still shows red color.
Screenshot is in attachment
Expected Results:
The port marked red recover to normal color after refresh time
Observed Results:

Reconstruct Frequency:
100%
Workaround:

Reconstruct in old releases Yes/No version number:

Steps to Reconstruct:

Browser Type & Version:

PC Operating System:

Testing Tools:

Port Used: Fast/Giga/X-gig/NR

Attachments: Movie/Screen capture/configuration/Set-Up Drawing/Sniffer

Fatal Error Message:
item.summary: The error rx port on Dashboard(Traffic Errors) still shows red color although interface counter and rmon statistics of proper ports are cleared.

comments.comment: dublicate TESLA22-1435
RN- need discuss with rest of cisco team
added to RN (fix not included in approved release.

item.title: [TESLA22-3107] UPOE port of PSE Switch cannot supply power to legacy IP phone
item.description:
Problem Description:

Expected Results:
Cisco IP phone7960 should power by DUT successfully

Observed Results:
Cisco IP phone7960 cannot power by DUT

Reconstruct Frequency:
Always

Workaround:

Reconstruct in old releases Yes/No version number:

Steps to Reconstruct:
1. Connect DUT port1 to Cisco IP phone7960
2. Check Cisco IP phone7960 whether phone can power by DUT or not

Browser Type & Version:

PC Operating System:

Testing Tools:

Port Used: Fast/Giga/X-gig/NR

Attachments: Movie/Screen capture/configuration/Set-Up Drawing/Sniffer

Fatal Error Message:
item.summary: UPOE port of PSE Switch cannot supply power to legacy IP phone

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Waiting for Microsemi -
Port Status: Port is off. Detection is in process

From Microsemi:
"After thoroughly analyzing this issue, we notice that the pins 12 & 36 in SF350-48MP ports, are in wrong polarity.
After we change the polarity (12 & 36 cross on the UTP cable), the Cisco 7960 was able to power up normally. "

"We found an internal short between pins 45 to 12 in Cisco phone 7960 (modules A0, B0, 08) and 7910 (module D0) as shown below.
We tested CAT3 straight cable (2pairs 12,36 only) as shown below and all phones worked well including 7960."

• Micro semi tests show that phone cannot be powered up due to a fault in the phone - an internal short between pins 45 to 12 of the phone,
• This means that issue is not with switch and not related to phone being a legacy phone.
• Issue occurs on UPoE ports since PoE uses all 4 pairs (including the ones creating a short).
• As a workaround a Cat 3 cable can be used to power up phone – since this prevents the short.

  • Another workaround - ALT B polarity change

RN- will not fix.

@Jiamin, same as previous decision to close TESLA22-3107 and RN, with 2 workarounds to (1) power this specific 7960 with our Tesla .AT ports (non UPoE ports) and (2) to use Cat3 cables.

Thanks,
— Solomon

NTF and RN.

Discussed with PE, will not fix.

Added more info on 7960:

Pega also verified 7960 rev A0/B0/E0, unable to work with UPoE ports.

Replacement phone 8841/8851 verified working with Tesla2/3 (UPoE/af/at ports).

Cisco EOL and replacement info on Cisco IP Phone 7960:
7960 EOL, and was replaced by 7962
Then 7962 eol’ed, and was replaced by 8841/8851

7960:2002, May(End of Sale), http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/collaboration-endpoints/unified-ip-phone-7900-series/prod_end-of-life_notice09186a0080088a2c.html

7962G:2016 Feb(End of Sale), http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/collaboration-endpoints/unified-ip-phone-7900-series/eos-eol-notice-c51-735570.html

7960G:2010.July(End of Sale), http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/collaboration-endpoints/unified-ip-phone-7940g/end_of_life_notice_c51-574072.html

item.title: [TESLA22-3042] After switch port XG1 connect Ixia port1 via DAC cable , the XG1 cannot configure 1G speed and disable auto negotiation at the same time
item.description:
Problem Description:

Expected Results:
The result1 and result2 should be the same

Observed Results:
The result1 can display error message” Port te1/0/1 cannot be configured to other speed than 10G.”
The result2 can change 1000M speed and no auto negotiation successfully

Reconstruct Frequency:
Always

Workaround:

Reconstruct in old releases Yes/No version number:

Steps to Reconstruct:
1. Test 1: Connect Ixia port1 to DUT port XG1 via DAC cable
2. Go to “Port Management> Port Settings”
3. Select port XG1 edit
4. “Disable” Auto Negotiation and Administrative Port Speed is “1000M” then apply ==>result1
5. Test 2: Connect Ixia port1 to DUT port XG1 via DAC cable
6. Go to “Port Management> Port Settings”
7. Select port XG1 edit
8. “Disable” Auto Negotiation then apply
9. Administrative Port Speed is “1000M” then apply ==>result2

Browser Type & Version:

PC Operating System:

Testing Tools:

Port Used: Fast/Giga/X-gig/NR

Attachments: Movie/Screen capture/configuration/Set-Up Drawing/Sniffer

Fatal Error Message:
item.summary: After switch port XG1 connect Ixia port1 via DAC cable , the XG1 cannot configure 1G speed and disable auto negotiation at the same time

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
WA: first disable negotiation, then configure speed 1G.
suggest postpone to 2.2.5
will discuss with rest of cisco bug scrub team

item.title: [TESLA22-2778] unit 1 fatal error after change stack unit-id from fix to auto
item.description:
Problem Description:
topo: SG350X stack

NAME: "1" DESCR: "SG350X-24MP 24-Port Gigabit PoE Stackable Managed Switch"
PID: SG350X-24MP VID: V02 SN: DNI19340027

NAME: "2" DESCR: "SG350X-48 48-Port Gigabit Stackable Managed Switch"
PID: SG350X-48 VID: V02 SN: DNI19330002

NAME: "3" DESCR: "SG350X-24 24-Port Gigabit Stackable Managed Switch"
PID: SG350X-24 VID: V02 SN: DNI19340049

NAME: "4" DESCR: "SG350X-48P 48-Port Gigabit PoE Stackable Managed Switch"
PID: SG350X-48P VID: V02 SN: DNI1933002V
switche67720#show stack configuration

Unit Id After Reboot Configuration

Unit Id Stack Links
-------- ------- ---------------
1 1 te1-4
2 2 te1-4
3 3 te1-4
4 4 te1-4
switche67720#show stack
Topology is Ring

Unit Id MAC Address Role Network Uplink
Port Port
Type Type
------- ------------------- -------- ------- ------
1 40:a6:e8:e6:77:20 master gi te
2 40:a6:e8:e6:52:de backup gi te
3 40:a6:e8:e6:7f:82 slave gi te
4 40:a6:e8:e6:67:c7 slave gi te
switche67720#show stack links

Topology is Ring

Unit Id Active Links Neighbor Links Operational Down/Standby
Link Speed Links
------- -------------------- -------------------- ----------- --------------------
1 te1/0/1-4 te2/0/3-4,te4/0/1-2 10G
2 te2/0/1-4 te1/0/3-4,te3/0/1-2 10G
3 te3/0/1-4 te2/0/1-2,te4/0/3-4 10G
4 te4/0/1-4 te1/0/1-2,te3/0/3-4 10G
steps:
1:reboot unit3 and unit4 for two times in debug mode.(not occur when reboot once)
2:change unit-id mode from "fix" to "Auto" then reload stack. stack unit-id don't change . and unit 1 will fatal error
Expected Results:
stack will recalculate the unit-id. no fatal error
Observed Results:
stack won't calculate the unit-id base the rules, unit 1 fatal error
22-Dec-2015 04:22:46 %2SWVLAN-F-VLNGETPORTS: SW2P_vlan_lif_action: TAPI error - failed to get port members for vlan id 1 - error msg Illegal size

          • FATAL ERROR *****
            Reporting Task: BRMN.
            Software Version: 2.2.0.33 (date Dec 29 2015 time 11:48:09)
            ros(HOSTG_fatal_error+0x14) [0x23bc20]
            ros(OSSYSG_fatal_error+0x148) [0x76f2c0]
            ros() [0x5a6540]
            ros(SW2G_vlan_cpu_action+0x348) [0x9ae24c]
            ros(NETC_vlan_l2_sap+0x22c) [0x85f2e4]
            ros() [0x8ac798]
            ros() [0x8bf3b0]
            ros() [0x6b331c]
            /lib/libp2linux.so.1(+0x3aa4) [0xb6f48aa4]
            /lib/libpthread.so.0(+0x6e64) [0xb6f23e64]
          • END OF FATAL ERROR *****

**************************************************

                                  • SYSTEM RESET *****************
                                    **************************************************

                                    always
                                    Workaround:

Reconstruct in old releases Yes/No version number:

Steps to Reconstruct:

PC Operating System:

Testing Tools:

Attachments: Movie/Screen capture/configuration/Set-Up Drawing/Sniffer

Fatal Error Message:

          • FATAL ERROR *****

item.summary: unit 1 fatal error after change stack unit-id from fix to auto

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment:
it also happen when power down/up unit 3 and unit 4 twice.steps:
1:power down/up unit3, after stack merged to one stack again.
2:power down/up unit4, after stack merged to one stack again.
3:power down/up unit3, after stack merged to one stack again.
4:power down/up unit4, after stack merged to one stack again.
5:change unit-id mode from "fix" to "Auto" then reload stack. stack unit-id don't change . and unit 1 will fatal error

PST per Marvell request.

still need review by rest of cisco team

item.title: [TESLA22-2777] DHCPv6 relay doesn't work if set destination to tunnel interface
item.description:
##TOPO
Server----DUT1--tunnel1----DUT2------PC

##Reproduce
1. Configure DUT1 as ISATAP router tunnel1
2. Configure DUT2 as ISATAP client tunnel1.
3. On DUT2, enable dhcpv6 relay on interface connected to PC, destination is tunnel1.
4. On DUT1, enable dhcpv6 relay on tunnel 1, destination is server's ipv6 address.
5. Start dhcpv6 session on PC. capture packets between DUT1 and DUT2.
no dhcpv6 packets.

6. On DUT2, change destination from tunnel1 to global address on ISATAP router. and repeat step 5.
PC can get ipv6 address from router.

DUT1:
ipv6 unicast-routing
bonjour interface range vlan 1
hostname switche64d73
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/1
ipv6 address 3::10/64
no switchport
!
interface GigabitEthernet2/0/1
ip address 1.1.1.1 255.255.255.0
ipv6 enable
no switchport
!
interface TengigabitEthernet2/0/1
ip address 192.168.1.95 255.255.255.0
no switchport
!
interface tunnel1
tunnel mode ipv6ip isatap
tunnel source loopback1
ipv6 address 300::/64 eui-64
ipv6 dhcp relay destination 3::30
!
interface loopback1
ip address 95.95.95.95 255.255.255.255
!
exit
macro auto disabled
monitor session 1 destination interface GigabitEthernet1/0/2
monitor session 1 source interface GigabitEthernet2/0/1 both
ip route 67.67.67.67 /32 1.1.1.2
switche64d73#

DUT2:
bonjour interface range vlan 1
hostname switche66f70
ip host isatap 95.95.95.95
!
interface vlan 1
ip address 192.168.1.67 255.255.255.0
no ip address dhcp
!
interface vlan 10
ipv6 enable
ipv6 nd ra suppress
ipv6 dhcp relay destination ff02::1:2 tunnel 1
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/1
ip address 1.1.1.2 255.255.255.0
ipv6 enable
no switchport
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/2
switchport access vlan 10
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/13
shutdown
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/24
shutdown
!
interface TengigabitEthernet1/0/1
shutdown
!
interface TengigabitEthernet1/0/2
shutdown
!
interface tunnel1
tunnel mode ipv6ip isatap
tunnel source loopback1
ipv6 address autoconfig
!
interface loopback1
ip address 67.67.67.67 255.255.255.255
!
exit
macro auto disabled
ip route 95.95.95.95 /32 1.1.1.1
switche66f70#
item.summary: DHCPv6 relay doesn't work if set destination to tunnel interface

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: risky to fix, suggest to fix in 2.3

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
##TOPO
Server----DUT1--tunnel1----DUT2------PC

##Reproduce
1. Configure DUT1 as ISATAP router tunnel1
2. Configure DUT2 as ISATAP client tunnel1.
3. On DUT2, enable dhcpv6 relay on interface connected to PC, destination is tunnel1.
4. On DUT1, enable dhcpv6 relay on tunnel 1, destination is server's ipv6 address.
5. Start dhcpv6 session on PC. capture packets between DUT1 and DUT2.
no dhcpv6 packets.

6. On DUT2, change destination from tunnel1 to global address on ISATAP router. and repeat step 5.
PC can get ipv6 address from router.

DUT1:
ipv6 unicast-routing
bonjour interface range vlan 1
hostname switche64d73
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/1
ipv6 address 3::10/64
no switchport
!
interface GigabitEthernet2/0/1
ip address 1.1.1.1 255.255.255.0
ipv6 enable
no switchport
!
interface TengigabitEthernet2/0/1
ip address 192.168.1.95 255.255.255.0
no switchport
!
interface tunnel1
tunnel mode ipv6ip isatap
tunnel source loopback1
ipv6 address 300::/64 eui-64
ipv6 dhcp relay destination 3::30
!
interface loopback1
ip address 95.95.95.95 255.255.255.255
!
exit
macro auto disabled
monitor session 1 destination interface GigabitEthernet1/0/2
monitor session 1 source interface GigabitEthernet2/0/1 both
ip route 67.67.67.67 /32 1.1.1.2
switche64d73#

DUT2:
bonjour interface range vlan 1
hostname switche66f70
ip host isatap 95.95.95.95
!
interface vlan 1
ip address 192.168.1.67 255.255.255.0
no ip address dhcp
!
interface vlan 10
ipv6 enable
ipv6 nd ra suppress
ipv6 dhcp relay destination ff02::1:2 tunnel 1
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/1
ip address 1.1.1.2 255.255.255.0
ipv6 enable
no switchport
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/2
switchport access vlan 10
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/13
shutdown
!
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/24
shutdown
!
interface TengigabitEthernet1/0/1
shutdown
!
interface TengigabitEthernet1/0/2
shutdown
!
interface tunnel1
tunnel mode ipv6ip isatap
tunnel source loopback1
ipv6 address autoconfig
!
interface loopback1
ip address 67.67.67.67 255.255.255.255
!
exit
macro auto disabled
ip route 95.95.95.95 /32 1.1.1.1
switche66f70#

item.title: [TESLA22-1226] [SQA] When Enable DHCP server and WBA, after DHCP client release ip, ip cannot expired.
item.description:
Problem Description:
When Enable DHCP server and WBA, after DHCP client release ip, ip cannot expired.

Expected Results:

Observed Results:

Reconstruct Frequency:
Always

Workaround:

Reconstruct in old releases Yes/No version number:

Steps to Reconstruct:
1. Connect PC to port1 and config DUT to internet.
2. Enable Web authentication to port1 and enable DUT DHCP server.
3. Observe default is unauthenticated on port1 before input username and password.
4. PC to get ip address from DHCP server.
5. Release PC ip (from DHCP ip to fixed ip), check ip can expired.
=> ip cannot expired (please refer attachment file)

Browser Type & Version:

PC Operating System:

Testing Tools:

Port Used: Fast/Giga/X-gig/NR

Attachments: Movie/Screen capture/configuration/Set-Up Drawing/Sniffer

Fatal Error Message:
item.summary: [SQA] When Enable DHCP server and WBA, after DHCP client release ip, ip cannot expired.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: bf (DHCP CLIENT receive ip address but not authenticated, can’t release IP address)
